Comment: It’s not at all clear how to have an impact as an American. I love my country and it’s been devastating to watch the laws and principles by which we live eroded by people without respect, without morals, without integrity. To me, it’s not an issue of “libs” or “maga” or opinion polls or political theater or stock prices…it’s about belief in our remarkable constitution and the laws we live by. How do we protect that? How can an ordinary person who is not a politician, a journalist, someone of any power and authority act in defense of the systems we rely on? This article is absolutely correct, but it is naive. Or, maybe too idealistic. We had a chance to act in the last election and we, as a people, failed to understand the danger. Now we pay the price. All that is left is hope that we will have another fair-enough election. If that is not available, there will be violence on all sides and it is scary as hell. It isn’t too late, maybe, but for most of us there is not much “acting” available. I will protect the people I love, I will speak when I can, I will hope that people with power will act bravely and I will do my level best to keep my eyes open, my heart clear for the moment any opportunity to restore our nation to sanity arises. It’s not being silent, it’s accepting that sometimes there is no way out but through.
